intro: Brachystelma bilobatum, commonly known as the two-lobed stone orchid, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, often rock-dwelling growth habit. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming during the warmer months. Its leaves are fleshy and adapted to store water, reflecting its succulent nature. Brachystelma bilobatum is often found in rocky outcrops and is well-suited to arid or semi-arid environments.
